skill.name: ghe-status
skill.description:
READ-ONLY quick overview of GitHub Elements workflow state. Shows active threads, phase distribution, and workflow health at a glance.

USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User asks "what's the status" or "show me the status"
- User asks "what threads are active" or "what am I working on"
- User asks "show me the workflow state" or "what's happening"
- User wants a quick overview before starting work
- Starting a session and need context

DO NOT USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User wants to CLAIM an issue (use ghe-claim)
- User wants to POST a checkpoint (use ghe-checkpoint)
- User wants to TRANSITION phases (use ghe-transition)
- User wants DETAILED metrics/health reports (use ghe-report)

EXAMPLES:
<example>
Context: User starting a session wants to see current state
user: "What's the github elements status?"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-status to show you the current workflow state"
</example>
<example>
Context: User wants to know what work is available
user: "Show me what threads are active"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-status to display active and available threads"
</example>
<example>
Context: Quick check before doing work
user: "What am I currently working on?"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-status to find your in-progress threads"
</example>
skill.summary: READ-ONLY quick overview of GitHub Elements workflow state. Shows active threads, phase distribution...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: The ghe-status skill is a read-only reporting tool that safely queries GitHub Issues for workflow status. It uses standard GitHub CLI commands and follows security best practices with no data exfiltration or code execution risks.

low_findings.title: External command execution via GitHub CLI
low_findings.description: The skill executes external 'gh' commands to query GitHub Issues. While this is legitimate functionality for a GitHub workflow tool, it technically has the capability to execute commands. The commands are limited to read-only operations like 'gh issue list' and 'gh issue view'.

low_findings.title: Debug log file creation
low_findings.description: Scripts create debug log files in .claude/hook_debug.log. This is standard logging behavior but technically writes outside the skill's directory. The logs contain debug information only and no sensitive data.

content.user_title: Check GitHub Elements workflow status instantly
content.value_statement: Stop manually checking GitHub Issues to track project progress. Get instant read-only status reports showing active threads, phase distribution, and workflow health with a single command.
actual_capabilities: Shows active DEV/TEST/REVIEW threads with assignees and last activity
Displays phase distribution (DEV: 3 active, TEST: 1 active, REVIEW: 0 active)
Lists available work ready for claiming
Reports workflow health metrics and violations
Tracks recent completions and cycle times
limitations: Read-only skill - cannot modify issues or workflow state
Only works with GitHub Elements labeled issues
Limited to repository where GHE is configured

use_cases.title: Daily standup status updates
use_cases.description: Quickly see what the team is working on without opening GitHub. Get phase distribution and identify bottlenecks.

use_cases.title: Session start context check
use_cases.description: Before starting work, see active threads and available issues. Avoid conflicts and pick up ready work.

use_cases.title: Workflow health monitoring
use_cases.description: Monitor checkpoint frequency, violation counts, and cycle times to improve team productivity.

prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the current GitHub Elements status

prompt_templates.title: Active threads
prompt_templates.scenario: See what team is working on

prompt_templates.title: Available work

output: | Issue | Type | Phase | Epic | Assignee | Last Activity |
DEV: 3 active | TEST: 1 active | REVIEW: 0 active

best_practices: Use at session start to understand current context and avoid conflicts
Check before claiming new work to see what's already in progress
Review Argos-queued work first as it represents urgent automation findings
anti_patterns: Don't use for detailed metrics - use ghe-report for comprehensive analysis
Don't use to claim issues - use ghe-claim for that functionality
Don't use for phase transitions - use ghe-transition instead

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: No, it only works with repositories configured for GitHub Elements workflow using the specific label system.

faq.question: Does it modify any GitHub Issues?
faq.answer: No, this is a read-only skill that only queries and displays information without making any changes.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works anywhere GitHub CLI is available and authenticated, including CI environments.

faq.question: Is my GitHub data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads public GitHub issue data using official GitHub CLI commands and doesn't store or transmit data elsewhere.

faq.question: Why does it show different information than GitHub's native issues view?
faq.answer: It filters and organizes issues based on GitHub Elements workflow labels and phases, providing workflow-specific insights.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Projects?
faq.answer: GitHub Elements provides AI-assisted workflow management with automated phase transitions and memory persistence through issue threads.
